section.title: Upload Dashboard Customizations
section.para: The JSON used to express customizations for the &COMPANYABBR; Dashboard is uploaded using the dashboard's administration interface. You can test these customizations using a sandbox environment before deploying them into production

The following are the steps for uploading a sample dashboard customization to a sandbox environment. When the customization is ready for production, translate these steps into your production environment:

step.para: Sign in to your developer portal, and then sign in to test applications in the sandbox portal using sample user James Stevenson from the Small Sample Dataset. This user has the IT Administrator role needed to upload custom configuration to the dashboard.
Click Admin in the upper right of the portal to open the administrator tools.

Click inBloom Dashboards under Application Configuration. Note the URL if you want to access this page directly in the future; in the hosted sandbox environment, the URL is https://dashboard.sandbox.inbloom.org/service/config.
Sample JSON is shown in . Copy that JSON into the text area on the dashboard configuration page. For your convenience, the sample is provided as a JSON file which may accompany this document.
shows the dashboard configuration page with some example JSON.
When the message appears confirming that the JSON was uploaded, click OK.
Click the logo in the upper left to return to the portal, and click inBloom Dashboards to open the application and view the customizations.
